title: Protesters released. 234 protesters are released from detainment. Kiev city hall and other public buildings are abandoned by occupiers, who had been there since 1 December. — BBC
Independence Square chaos. Within 48 hours, at least 88 people are killed. — BBC
Pro-Russian gunmen sieze buildings in capital of Crimea. Although Viktor Yanukovych has fled to Russia, he insists that he is still the president.— BBC
Russian parliament approves the use of force. Vladimir Putin gets the green light to use force in Ukraine while pro-Russian rallies are held in cities around Crimea.— BBC
Crimea's parliament votes to join Russia. Vladimir Putin gets the green light to use force in Ukraine while pro-Russian rallies are held in cities around Crimea.— BBC

Increased sanctions. EU leaders condemns annexation of Crimea. US and EU extend sanctions against those involved with Russia. Vladimir Putin gets the green light to use force in Ukraine while pro-Russian rallies are held in cities around Crimea.— BBC

Slight withdrawal. According to the German government, President Putin orders a partial troop withdrawal from Ukrainian border. Vladimir Putin gets the green light to use force in Ukraine while pro-Russian rallies are held in cities around Crimea.— BBC

Threats to withold gas. President Putin warns of witholding gas from Ukraine if no payment ensues. Vladimir Putin gets the green light to use force in Ukraine while pro-Russian rallies are held in cities around Crimea.— BBC

Anti-terrorist operations restart. Ukraine begins military operations against pro-Russian militants again after weeks of stalled efforts. Two men found 'tortured to death' in eastern Ukraine, one was a politician.— BBC
